@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The grid layout manager arranges the items in a two dimensional grid. Widgets can be placed into the grid's cells and may span multiple rows and columns. *Features* * Flex values for rows and columns * Minimal and maximal column and row sizes * Manually setting of column and row sizes * Horizontal and vertical alignment * Horizontal and vertical spacing * Column and row spans * Auto-sizing *Item Properties*
  • row (Integer): The row of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • column (Integer): The column of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • rowSpan (Integer): The number of rows, the widget should span, starting from the row specified in the row property. The cells in the spanned rows must be empty as well.
  • colSpan (Integer): The number of columns, the widget should span, starting from the column specified in the column property. The cells in the spanned columns must be empty as well.
*Example* Here is a little example of how to use the grid layout. 
var layout = new qx.ui.layout.Grid();
layout.setRowFlex(0, 1); // make row 0 flexible
layout.setColumnWidth(1, 200); // set with of column 1 to 200 pixel

var container = new qx.ui.container.Composite(layout);
container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 0});
container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 1});
container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 1, column: 0, rowSpan: 2});
*External Documentation* Extended documentation and links to demos of this layout in the qooxdoo manual.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
spacingX {Integer?0} The horizontal spacing between grid cells.
Sets {@link #spacingX}.
@param.description:
The horizontal spacing between grid cells.
Sets {@link #spacingX}.

Sets {@link #spacingY}.
@param.description:
The vertical spacing between grid cells.
Sets {@link #spacingY}.

@param.body: key {String} The key under which the data should be stored
@param.description: The key under which the data should be stored

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Shortcut to set both horizontal and vertical spacing between grid cells
to the same value.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: spacing {Integer} new horizontal and vertical spacing

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the default cell alignment for a column. This alignment can be overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's alignX and alignY properties. If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken from the row.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hAlign {String} The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
"left", "center" and "right".
@param.description:
The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
"left", "center" and "right".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
vAlign {String} The vertical alignment. Valid values are
"top", "middle", "bottom"
@param.description:
The vertical alignment. Valid values are
"top", "middle", "bottom"

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a map of the column's alignment.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal column alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal column alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the default cell alignment for a row. This alignment can be overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's alignX and alignY properties. If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken from the row.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hAlign {String} The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
"left", "center" and "right".
@param.description:
The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
"left", "center" and "right".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
vAlign {String} The vertical alignment. Valid values are
"top", "middle", "bottom"
@param.description:
The vertical alignment. Valid values are
"top", "middle", "bottom"

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a map of the row's alignment.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal row alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal row alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the widget located in the cell. If a the cell is empty or the widget has a {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#visibility} value of exclude, null is returned.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget|null}The cell's widget. The value may be null.
@return.description: The cell's widget. The value may be null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the number of rows in the grid layout.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The number of rows in the layout
@return.description: The number of rows in the layout

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the number of columns in the grid layout.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The number of columns in the layout
@return.description: The number of columns in the layout

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get a map of the cell's alignment. For vertical alignment the row alignment
takes precedence over the column alignment. For horizontal alignment it is
the over way round. If an alignment is set on the cell widget using
{@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#setLayoutProperties}, this alignment takes
always precedence over row or column alignment.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the flex value for a grid column. By default the column flex value is 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the flex value of a grid column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the flex value for a grid row. By default the row flex value is 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the flex value of a grid row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the maximum width of a grid column. The default value is Infinity.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the maximum width of a grid column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the preferred width of a grid column. The default value is Infinity.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the preferred width of a grid column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the minimum width of a grid column. The default value is 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the minimum width of a grid column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the maximum height of a grid row. The default value is Infinity.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the maximum height of a grid row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the preferred height of a grid row. The default value is Infinity.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the preferred height of a grid row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the minimum height of a grid row. The default value is 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the minimum height of a grid row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Computes the widget's size hint including the widget's margins

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The widget to get the size for
@param.description: The widget to get the size for

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Check whether all row spans fit with their preferred height into the
preferred row heights. If there is not enough space, the preferred
row sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max
values of the rows.

The same is true for the min sizes.

The height array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowHeights {Map[]} The current row height array as computed by
{@link #_getRowHeights}.
@param.description:
The current row height array as computed by
{@link #_getRowHeights}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Check whether all col spans fit with their preferred width into the
preferred column widths. If there is not enough space the preferred
column sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max
values of the columns.

The same is true for the min sizes.

The width array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
colWidths {Map[]} The current column width array as computed by
{@link #_getColWidths}.
@param.description:
The current column width array as computed by
{@link #_getColWidths}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute the min/pref/max row heights.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} An array containing height information for each row. The entries have the keys minHeight, maxHeight and height.
@return.description: An array containing height information for each row. The entries have the keys minHeight, maxHeight and height.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute the min/pref/max column widths.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} An array containing width information for each column. The entries have the keys minWidth, maxWidth and width.
@return.description: An array containing width information for each column. The entries have the keys minWidth, maxWidth and width.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Computes for each column by how many pixels it must grow or shrink, taking
the column flex values and min/max widths into account.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer[]} Sparse array of offsets to add to each column width. If
an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.
@return.description:
Sparse array of offsets to add to each column width. If
an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Computes for each row by how many pixels it must grow or shrink, taking
the row flex values and min/max heights into account.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer[]} Sparse array of offsets to add to each row height. If
an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the row.
@return.description:
Sparse array of offsets to add to each row height. If
an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the row.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property spacingX. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacingX}.

@description.name: @description

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #spacingY}.
